result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Douglas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ***ORDER GRANTING REQUEST:  June 24, 2014/Judge Daniel Konkol, Court grants 70 days of sentence credit on this case.***

superMiscConds.notes: No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done.  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Attempting to Flee or Elude a Traffic Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario Douglas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant requesting to vacate DNA surcharge.
dated June 26, 2014 the time for filing a notice of intent to pursue post conviction relief is extended to 8/6/14. tf
Decision and Order Partially Granting Request for Sentence Credit received and filed.  Copies mailed to State and attorney./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
Defendant's request for sentence credit.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 months -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 14 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 16 months; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) seek and maintain employment.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Mario Douglas in court with attorney Gabriel W Houghton.  Defendant Mario Douglas in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On Motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing.
State's Witness List, State's Requested Jury Instructions and Jury Instructions received and filed./ds

Defendant Mario Douglas in court with attorney Gabriel W Houghton.  Defendant Mario Douglas in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on other acts evidence proceeds.  Arguments by counsel.   Court allows State to ask the officers how they know the defendant.  Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Response to State's Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence received and filed./ds

Attorney Gabriel W Houghton in court, defendant Mario Douglas not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Motion hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mario Douglas in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Defendant Mario Douglas in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy  Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to dismiss proceeds.  Arguments by counsel.   Court finds defense has not been able to establish any actual prejudice and has not shown  the state to have a tactical advantage.  Court denies defense motion.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Based on PreCharging Delay received and filed./ds

Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court, defendant Mario Douglas not in court, in custody.  William Levins for Nathaniel Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

State's response to be filed by noon on 3-28-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Based on Precharging Delay received and filed./ds

Defendant Mario Douglas in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Defendant Mario Douglas in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #05CF2713 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:John Pukansky-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mario Douglas in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Mario Douglas in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
